Hmmm...distinguishing them is quite difficult, but they are all beautiful.

The spring sunlight is getting more intense.
At this rate, summer's just around the corner. We should enjoy going on spring excursions while we have the chance!

Senpai, do you know the difference between hiking and picnicking? Supposedly it's a difference between whether your focus is on walking or eating your lunch.
I think both are wonderful. After all, both activities involve an outing with you!

Viewing flowers is fun, but I hear that it's more fun if you are able to drink.
How much happier do you think these people who can drink and view flowers are, compared to us?
I'd sure like to be an adult soon...

Spring is winding down. Is there anything you wanted to do, Senpai?
And don't forget to do this mission, of course!

Master. Da Vinci said she hung some flags shaped like carp outside the Border! She says she made them inconspicuous using some sort of active camouflage effect or something!
It's great that we won't be detected by enemies, but I can't see them that well either...

How curious. It's been said in the past by many others, but I also feel that the combination of rain and hydrangeas are wonderful.
Is this what you call aesthetics?

Today's weather tells us that it's the start of summer.
Let's get our bodies ready in anticipation of the season to come!

The situation has been resolved.
What had happened in the Singularity will never be recorded in history, but it will remain within our memories.
I just hope I can accompany Senpai in the battles to come.

We should enjoy the time spent indoors in a meaningful way, especially when we can't go outdoors. Whether that's helping clean up your room, or playing board games with you, Mash Kyrielight will be ready at a moments notice!

Celebrating our four year anniversary...
I'm not entirely sure why, but saying that is exciting. I have a feeling we will meet a lot of new people!
I hear Caesar is working out in preparation for summer. He is a Servant though, so I don't think there will be much change...
We're at the halfway point of the year. Let's plan ahead for the rest of the year!

Summer is here!
I'm even excited about the Master Missions.
Let's not succumb to the heat and make sure we keep our health and safety in mind!

The Holy Grails that we've been collecting are genuine, potent sources of magical energy.
The Holy Grail that is said to be an omnipotent wish granting device, while its structure is similar to ours, is different in scale and lifespan. Please don't forget that.
We now have more Servants wearing swimsuits, but I'm starting to hope that Senpai starts wearing one as well.

It looks like the summer festivities have ended without incident.
It doesn't seem like we have another big event for a while, so let's just take it easy.

Are you leveling up everyone's Skills?
Some Servants can fight well even with low level Skills, while some Skills change in functionality entirely when they reach maximum level. Think carefully when enhancing them, and your tactical options will expand.

While you have only a limited number of Holy Grails, hoarding them would also be a waste.
Please use them on Servants who you feel you should.

We managed to return safely once more.
Our battles will get tougher, so please command me with all your resolve.
...Anyway, here are the resources we collected this time!
What's this? Well, I asked Ms. Murasaki to recommend some books. They say that autumn is the best season for reading, you know!

Even if it's just in the simulator, maybe we should go see the autumn foliage.
I'll be more than happy to apprentice under Cat to learn the art of bento-making!

Hm!? A blackout.
Don't worry. I'm an expert at this now.
I can give you your Saint Quartz Fragments with my eyes closed. Here you go!

The base's population is booming, but it's just you and me here as usual.
I kind of like that this place stays constant and unchanging.

The distinctive scent that fills the air when I pull our winter clothes out of storage conjures so many memories...
I like that it reminds me of the seasons changing.

Now that I think about it, do you suppose it snows in the Wandering Sea?
And if it does, I wonder what that looks like. I'm very curious about this...
I'll ask Sion next time!

The Santa Servants are starting to get restless.
I guess it's that time of the year already!

In preparation for the big end of the year cleaning, I've stocked up on new cleaning supplies!!
Now I'll be ready anytime!

Senpai! I hear Beni-Enma is going to prepare us all special New Year's soba!
Oh my...
I'm getting so excited, I'm feeling dizzy!

Happy New Year, Master!
I love how this year is just full of twos!
And on that note, let's begin this year with a fresh mindset...too!

I hear people usually either spend the New Year by taking it easy or going out and painting the town red...
How do you spend your time, Senpai?

It's a new year.
This might be an opportune time to try something new!

What is your favorite way to eat mochi, Senpai?
My favorite way is...
Hmmm...I really can't decide, to be honest...

I just had an epiphany about a new food to eat at the kotatsu that beats mandarin oranges or nabeyaki udon!
Ice cream!
It's a true guilty pleasure only advanced kotatsu experts will appreciate!

The season of sweets is upon us once again.
Just don't forget to brush your teeth to prevent cavities, Master.

The days are still chilly.
When I wake up in the morning and find Fou sleeping next to me in bed, I feel very lucky.

Did you know that the next leap year is going to be in two years?
Just the thought of having an extra day in a year makes me feel like I gained something special, Senpai!

It's March.
Did you know that the month is named after Mars, the god of war?
...I wonder how Altera would react if she heard.

So this dish is called chirashizushi!?
It's so colorful and it's definitely fit for auspicious events!
I'm sure it's also delicious...!
Gulp!
It's hard to notice the changing of the seasons here...but it's probably best to continue to bear that in mind.

Have you ever been to a school orientation before, Senpai?
I hear it makes you quite nervous...
Please tell me about it one of these days!

Flower-viewing season is upon us once again, and the simulator is very popular right now.
Shall we also check it out, Senpai?
I'll prepare a picnic, blanket and all!

All resources are valuable.
Remember that dazzling sparkle, and be thrilled by that spiky shape...
Come on, Master! Let's get to work on our missions!

Old Japanese calendars used to call the month of May "Satsuki," which is associated with the rice planting season.
If we have the chance, I would very much like to try my hand at planting rice!
...If there is ever such a mission, that is...

Whoa! Senpai and Fou just yawned at the same time!
I wish I'd taken a picture of such perfect synchronization!
Hehe...feeling drowsy all the time is a sure sign that it's spring!

I've gotten the hang of polishing Saint Quartz Fragments!
They're shiny enough that you can see yourself in them, Senpai!
...Do you think if we ask Da Vinci, she could make this a part of some sort of interior design?

Senpai, here are your new workout outfits and indoor shoes. Please wear them during your workout routine.
I also received a similar set with the same design!
Maybe you and I should go on a jog together?

It's starting to feel like summer.
I have a strange sense that this summer will be our scariest ever...
No, I shouldn't say such crazy things... Please ignore what I said!

It's the most humid part of the year, so make sure to get a lot of circulation in your room!
You wouldn't want to be scolded by bread makers for accidently letting their bread get moldy, Senpai!

It's almost summer.
You may want to just settle for eating something simple, but try to eat a well-balanced meal to build up your strength.

Missions may change on a weekly basis, but you have plenty of time to complete them.
Work on the missions at your own pace.

"Playing board games is fine, but it's also good to have an outdoor hobby, like fishing."
...At least that's what Emiya said.
Fishing in Chaldea...may be a bit challenging.

The hot summer has come once again!
I hear that people get extended days-off during this time.
Prepare yourself well against the heat and enjoy your vacation!

Use the Holy Grails you obtained to further strengthen your Servants' Spirit Origins.
You may feel compelled to hold on to them, but sometimes it's best to take the plunge and use them!

Summer excursions aren't just limited to the beach.
You can enjoy camping up in the mountains...
It appears you can even play in and learn from nature.
That does seem fun.

We're about halfway through the year already.
The days may still be hot, but let's keep a positive mindset and live the time we have to the fullest!

I hear that Ascension and strengthening a Servant's Spirit Origin using a Holy Grail are different things.
A Heroic Spirit's Spirit Origin is set based on a Servant's information from their past life, no matter how far you Ascend them. But you can use a Holy Grail to foster a special kind of growth.

Is your party fully strengthened and at the ready?
Instead of focusing only on Servants specializing in offense, try training Servants who specialize in defense and support too.

The records of those who left their mark on human history, whether good or bad, which are known as Heroic Spirits in Chaldea, are collected and stored in a higher realm called the Throne.
...And that's why anybody who has not achieved anything truly great never becomes a Servant candidate.
Though it seems that occasionally, a string of coincidences and a touch of fate can lead to a miracle.

Summer is over, and we're heading into the next season.
Is your wardrobe ready for the changing season?
Please take every precaution to ensure you stay healthy!

Try raising various Servants in anticipation of the many battles ahead.
Servants are all unique in their own way, and they are all reliable when the time comes!

A war between Masters over the Holy Grail...
I read about it in our archives, but I never thought something like that would happen in Chaldea too. I am...I am...quite moved!

You're wondering if I'm a good dancer?
Not really. It was an elective in my training curriculum, but I did not take it...
Pepe and Kirschtaria did take the course, so I just watched and copied what they did...

Changing into different Mystic Codes depending on the situation is what makes a veteran Master. There are many skills associated with the different Mystic Codes, so please try changing to suit your party.

Christmas is here!
I wonder what sort of Santa we'll have this year? I'm so excited!
Dairi, the inner palace of the Heian period, and the Kyoto Imperial Palace in modern-day Kyoto City are not located in the same place. Dairi was supposedly west of the Kyoto Imperial Palace.

Servants are divided into attack and support types. A majority of the Caster-class Servants are support types, so try not to form your party with just Sabers or Lancers; try using Casters to help you out.

It's now 2023. Happy New Year!
I hope we have yet another wonderful year, Senpai!

This year is the Year of the Ox. It’s Raikou’s year!
Oh. I wasn't thinking about her physique, but rather about when she got really serious at Onigashima...
It's getting really cold now. Don't forget to wear gloves and a mask when you head out. Your neck is the most vulnerable to cold, so wearing a scarf would also be helpful.

Osechi, the traditional Japanese New Years meal set, is a nice culinary tradition.
It's aesthetically pleasing, each dish goes down easy, and they're all so delicious...
The fact that most of the dishes are sweet is wonderful too!
I hear that you can eat the same amount of black soybeans as your age! Yay!
There are more Daily and Weekly mission types now. But don't worry if you're busy. You just need to do the quests at your own pace.
The season for chocolates is upon us once again. Please be careful not to get any cavities, Senpai.
Have you been using Holy Grails, Master? You can spread them among numerous Servants or focus on one Servant. There's nothing for you to lose, so have at it.

By the way, I picked this up earlier. It seems like some sort of...calling card.
I thought it was Carmilla's, but it's not. The plot thickens, Senpai.

March... It's graduation season in Japan.
I hear there's a Japanese custom to ask for a button from someone's uniform. Specifically, the second button from the top.
What about you, Senpai...no, wait! Never mind!

Orion was agonizing over what to give Artemis as a return gift. He was claiming that it would also  be terrible if he put TOO much sentiment into his return gift too. That is definitely a concern you'd only have with Artemis.
QP, short for Quantum Pieces, should be diligently collected and saved. You may not use much at first, but you will gradually have more and more use for them.

One, two, three...
Oh, Senpai! N-nothing. I was just practicing my dancing, since it's spring and all.
Would you like to join me, Senpai?
Edison is currently researching whether we can increase the amount of Saint Quartz Fragments. I  honestly think that's a tall order, even for the king of inventions...

This is... a very valuable resource! 
You always work so hard, and now I've finally seen your destiny realized!

If you use just one Servant as an attacker during a turn, you will only be able to attack one enemy. But if you put a Noble Phantasm between attacks, you can potentially attack two or even three enemies. Think about the enemy's HP gauge and build strategies.
You'll wind up out of shape if you stay cooped up in Chaldea. Would you like to try some training exercises you could do indoors?
According to Da Vinci's analysis, we're bound to see a lot of minute Singularities again this year. Let's try our best to tackle them, Senpai!
Firing Noble Phantasms in one turn feels really good...but certain enemies have Break Bars, so it's meaningless to inflict damage with your Noble Phantasm on those enemies. Please be careful.

June... It's the rainy season in Japan.
Senpai, when you told me the Japanese term uses the kanji "plum" and "rain," I thought it meant the rain was sour like plums. Teehee.

Holmes is the world's most famous detective, and he has been the subject of many paintings and sculptures. However, the inverness coat and deerstalker hat he's famously depicted with were never described in the original stories. That was apparently created by the person who was in charge of the book's illustrations.
Evade and Invincibility have two different durations: times and turns. The times effect is quickly used up if you're up against large enemies who have AOE attacks, so please be careful.
Summer's about to start again. I have a feeling a thrilling adventure awaits us! Let's prepare while we have the chance!

Have you been practicing proper precautions against the heat? Please be careful not to get afflicted with heat stress, Senpai.
Then again, it's not good to cool yourself too much too. Balancing both is quite challenging...

The C. Stars dropped from attacking enemies or from skills increase the chance to inflict a Critical Hit by 10% each.
Please also keep in mind that certain classes have easier or harder times gathering C. Stars.
It's getting even hotter these days. Please do take care of yourself, Senpai. I hear Emiya is thinking up dishes that are good for fighting the heat.

I believe holding hands is proof of trust and friendship.
...Ahem. Senpai, would you like to shake hands?
I know the days have been hot, but it'll be autumn soon, and that's more comfortable. Until then, let's enjoy the summer, Senpai.
It's September already. Time sure does fly. I hear in Japan many fruits are in season. What kind of fruits were available and loved in your hometown, Master?
The seasons in the northern and southern hemispheres are flipped. For example, in Australia, it's a pleasantly warm spring right now and it's supposed to get hotter and hotter.
Edison and Tesla claim to have invented a "revolutionary weather forecast machine." But honestly, where in Chaldea are they going to use this device?

It's autumn! Master, I hope you're prepared.
Come on, let's prepare pumpkins!

Master, Master!
Elisabeth is in such a good mood, she started singing in the cafeteria! Everyone's begging you to go to the cafeteria immediately!

It's starting to get chilly.
Try not to catch a cold due to the changing seasons. Make sure you're well-protected from the cold before you Rayshift! Though the season wherever you Rayshift may not necessarily be the same...

It's winter now. Prepare all the necessary equipment so you aren't harmed by the harsh weather.
Just like combat, it's important to be on your guard and defend yourself!

(Huff, huff...)
!
I can't believe the sweet potato we roasted using just the leaves we collected turned out so delicious... What kind of skill did you use, Senpai!?
Scheherazade is going to hold a reading tonight. I'm excited to see what kind of story she'll read. But I need to be careful not to stay up too late because I get too engrossed in it.

We need to do some major cleaning to prepare for the new year. Let's get to it, Master!
Come to think of it, even though we've gotten more sophisticated equipment and technology to help us clean, why it still takes the same amount of time and effort is a mystery.
I wonder...
Even more delicious scents than ever are filling the air this Christmas! I wonder what kind of feast we'll have this year?

There's only so many more days left in the year. Do you have any unfinished business before the new year, Senpai?
Letting the last, busiest month of the year pass in idleness is a loss of time. But try not to give up yet!

Happy New Year.
I'm very happy to be able to say that once again this year to you and everyone else.

Happy New Year, Senpai.
This year is the Year of the Tiger. Might I suggest visiting a shrine with Jaguar Warrior and Tamamo Cat?
Huh? Tamamo Cat technically doesn’t fit into that category? Y-you’re right!

I wonder what sort of places we'll go, and what kind of things we'll see this year...
It would be wonderful if we could look back on these memories with a smile one day.
Master! Did you know that a different type of ozoni, the new year's mochi soup, has appeared this year!? I had no idea this dish was so versatile! That teaches me not to underestimate ozoni.
Uh. Fou is hanging around my neck and relaxing... This is the first time he's done that this year. I don't need to wear a scarf because he's keeping me warm...very nice.

Happy New Year. 
I look forward to working with you again this year!

Have you been to the temple yet? 
If not, then let's go together...!

Happy New Year, Senpai.
I'm glad to have a chance to tell you that this year.

Have you had your first dream of the new year, Senpai?
I have yet to have my own, so I'm going to try my best tonight!

Have you had your first dream of the new year, Senpai?
I have yet to have my own, so I'm going to try my best tonight!

Have you had your first dream of the new year, Senpai?
I have yet to have my own, so I'm going to try my best tonight!

Early sunrises, late sunsets...
When the days get long, it's nice to feel how long the days are, Senpai.

Surprisingly, this year is more than half over. 
Let's make a plan in advance and calmly carry it out, Master!
I heard people go to the beach in the summer. A bathing suit... I don't think I'm ready for that, but I'd like to ray shift at the beach and go swimming.

...So this is Earth's summer...
Do your best, Senpai. Don't let the heat get you down.
Well done, Master. You should go ask the doctor for some shaved ice when you get a chance.

Here you are, have some nice, cool barley tea. 
Stay hydrated so the heat doesn't wear you out, Senpai.
This heat isn't going to let up any time soon, but I hear the dog days of summer are the best. Keep fighting, Master!

It's easy to get sick when the seasons change. 
Take care of yourself, Senpai.
By the way... Do you think Fou has a fur shedding season?
Now that it's gotten cooler, it's much easier to be active. Would you like to come train with me, Senpai?
Autumn food is delicious. I love freshly baked bread!
Fall foliage... I hear that in Japan, the mountains become completely covered in red leaves, like they're on fire... I'd love to go and see the leaves with you, Senpai.

Do you have your coat ready? 
It's finally getting cold out, Master.

Please inform me if you catch a cold. 
I'll do my best to nurse you back to health!

Next month is packed with events. 
Are you ready, Senpai?

This year is nearly over. 
Keep working hard until the end, Master!
The decisive battle is near, but please try to relax here. Let's do this the way we always do.
It's cold outside, but I feel warm when you're near, Senpai. Is this also an example of the heat island effect?

It seems there are many benefits of eating rice cakes, such as longevity. 
Master, what do you think about having rice cakes at every meal?

So this is Ozoni soup... 
It's very tasty. It feels like it's warming me up from inside.
It's been very cold... I'm just a little jealous of Fou.

There's a warm spring waiting for us if we can just get through this cold. 
Let's be sure to keep warm until then, Master!

There's a sweet smell coming from somewhere...
Senpai, do you like sweets?

If we added wheels to a kotatsu, that would be an amazing machine...
I'm sure it'd be more useful than Da Vinci's gauntlets...

It's eased up a bit, but it's still chilly. 
Make sure to wrap up warmly when you sleep, Senpai.

I hear that in Japan, spring is known as the season of meeting and parting. 
Both of them are important.

I heard that everything is dyed pink when the cherry blossoms are in full bloom... 
If such a dreamy landscape exists I'd like to go see it with you, Senpai.

It's a lot warmer now, but spring is also cold season. 
Senpai, please take care of yourself even more than usual, okay?

Hay fever... yes, I hear that the symptoms are terrible. 
Are you all right Senpai?

I get sleepy when it gets warmer. Shall we rest a bit?
Leave the schedule to me. If you let me know when you want to be woken up, I'll wake you up on the dot!

It's much easier to carry out daily activities now that it's warmer.
But I kind of miss the cool of winter a little.

Here, have a warm cup of tea.
It's not the best grade of tea... but I hope you like it.

When I'm with you my heart rate changes.
...Is this a symptom of the so-called "Senioritis," Senpai?

It's a very rainy season, isn't it?
Let's check the weather for our destination so we don't get wet, or just carry an umbrella everywhere!

It's time for short sleeves, but do you have UV protection, Master?
Careful attention is effective in the long run.

S-so this is a teruteru bozu, the Japanese talisman said to bring good weather!
I see...
It does look like it's smiling at me.
How cute!

It feels like it really is summer, especially during the day.
But then again, it can get surprisingly chilly at night.
Let's make sure we regulate our body temperatures.

Um, Senpai, have you seen Fou around?
I haven't seen him anywhere...

A festival?
I hear that in Japan one wears a summer kimono to enjoy watching fireworks while eating things called "cotton candy" and "chocolate-covered bananas."
If I have the chance, I would like to watch fireworks with Senpai.

Leave it to Mash Kyrielight, Master.
I shall obtain two servings of frozen treats, right away!

Let's be mindful of our health if we want to enjoy our summer.
Don't forget to stay hydrated, Senpai.

It may be hard to sleep when it's so hot, but make sure you don't overuse the AC.
I hear that getting too cold is bad for even the sturdiest of psyches!

It's still very hot, but summer will be over soon.
I suggest we prepare for fall!

There's only a little over three months left in the year.
If there's anything you haven't finished yet, you should get to work soon!

I hear that in Japan there is a time of the year where the deceased are remembered.
To know that such a thing has taken root warms my heart.

Senpai, I have freshly-baked bread, so I would like to share―
Calories...?
...No, I've never heard that word before.
...This is the first I've ever heard of it.

The temperature difference between night and day is getting more extreme.
Do not forget to bring a jacket when you go out.

I hear that sunsets during this season are particularly beautiful. A heartwarming, nostalgic kind of thing...
Chaldea is my home, so it's disappointing that I do not get to see many sunsets.

There are still warm days, but the nights are truly chilly...
Shall I prepare something warm to drink, Senpai?

How are you keeping yourself from getting sick, Senpai?
Don't forget to always wash your hands and stay warm! You should be diligent!

I hear that when it gets cold, people yearn for the touch of another.
Senpai... Is...is that true?

The battle for the warmth of the kotatsu―The First Kotatsu War―has broken out, and casualties are mounting...
Master, let's go.
We need to put an end to this.

...The investigators from the Mage's Association are coming soon...
I'm sure big changes are coming, but I hope that my memories of these past two years will remain the same...and Doctor's room, too.

Herring roe, rolled kelp, kurikinton...
What is your favorite osechi dish, Senpai?

Da Vinci has prepared a game of hanetsuki and bamboo stilts in the Recreation Room, for a limited time.
Would you like to go, Senpai?
A new year may have come, but it's still the dead of winter. Please take good care of yourself, Senpai.

February...
It's the season of sweet smells floating through the air. We need to be careful about eating too many sweets, Master.

It's so cold, I won't be surprised if it starts snowing.
If it does snow, I would like to make an igloo.

Tangerines, tea, and a dotera robe...
Tee hee, what do you think, Senpai? I am a proper kotatsu Master now, right?

Winter or spring... I'm not sure which seasonal equipment to chose right now.
I suppose it's a nice problem to have, though.
It seems the men are working hard on something...

Grass and trees waiting to sprout through a covering of snow...
With that image in mind, let's store up our power, too!

Oh, Senpai...I'm sorry, I didn't notice you.
It's so warm, and holding onto Fou...so fluffy... It's so nice... Just sitting here...
Zzzzz... Zzzz...

...Wow, that thunder was loud.
So this is the iconic spring thunder...
Though it's hard not to wonder if someone just fired off their Noble Phantasm, too.

A new battlefield... New equipment...
Our situation seems dire, but let's take a deep breath and move forward!

The days are no longer just nice and warm, but truly hot.
Summer is getting close, Senpai.

...?
What is that smell coming from you, Senpai...?
I see, sweet flag water...
What an interesting custom.

Have you gotten used to riding the Shadow Border?
I hope we have some medicine for car sickness...

Every fortune starts off small. 
Let's keep up this pace, Senpai!

Reward acquired. 
Use it wisely, Senpai.

Clink, clink... Huh!? 
I'm fine. I wasn't playing with valuable resources. I swear.

Resources successfully acquired, Master. 
It's so small that it might slip between your fingers, but this is a valuable resource as well.

Bring it to Da Vinci's workshop once you've collected enough. 
I'll leave it up to you to decide how to use it.

They say big things have small beginnings.
Let's move forward, one step at a time!

I want to keep saying this so that we never lose our sense of accomplishment:
Good work, Senpai!

Idle time can make a person negligent.
Please be careful not to leave anything undone, Senpai.

I'm a little curious...
Just how many Fragments have you collected so far?

Hmmm, hm, hmmm, hmmm, hmmm, hmmm♪
Hm, hm...gyah!?
S-Senpai, how long have you been standing there!?

Fou's body is damp from all this humidity...
This is where I get to show off my dryer and brush technique!

I've only seen it in the videos in the library, but I would love to see real fireflies glow.
And hopefully...um...with Senpai...

Lostbelts...
The possibilities that were deemed unnecessary and placed on dead-end tracks...
So those are what our next enemies are going to be...
This weather makes you all sweaty even if you're standing still. You might catch a cold if you don't do anything about it, so make sure you're staying dry or changing, Senpai.

What is my favorite firework, you ask?
It may be a dull response, but I do like Japanese sparklers. They only last for a little bit, which makes it sad, but it does remind me that I should cherish those brief moments.
What kind of wish did you write down for Tanabata? I wrote...um, well, it's a secret.

I'm not sure what this thing Da Vinci gave me is...
Hm? An inflatable pool?
I can't believe this can make a pool inside a room! I must try this out.
Please standby, Master...I'm just going to change into my swimsuit really quick!

Bamboo arranged around the room in such an intricate network... Does this mean tonight's menu is going to be somen noodles delivered on a bamboo water slide, or nagashi somen?
I would never have imagined we could have such a fun meal in our current situation!

It's very hot outside, and opening up the Border's windows to let the breeze in feels so nice.
Traveling is wonderful!

The moon-viewing season is here once again.
That chaotic scene over dumplings brings back memories like it was just yesterday.

You've done splendidly in the Singularity.
We were lucky to collect such precious resources.
We must make good use of them.
It's still quite hot, so please be mindful of your health. If you feel anything strange, please head to the infirmary immediately. You should never drag your feet about things like this.

What comes to mind when we talk about the month of September, Senpai?
I see... Typhoons and the chirping of bugs...
I suppose there wouldn't be any of those in a place like this.
It looks like Fou's growing his winter coat. To be honest, it's hard to tell because he's already so fluffy.

It's the season of fall reading.
On a day like today, I would love to just relax and read a book until I fall asleep. Are there any books that you recommend, Senpai?

Senpai, according to Da Vinci's weather forecast, it's supposed to be unusually chilly today. It might be a good idea to take a jacket with you. But I can also warm you up using Ortinax's radiators if needed!

Oh I-I'm sorry, Senpai. Did I wake you?
I saw that you fell asleep at your desk, so I thought I would cover you with a blanket so you wouldn't catch a cold...
I-I didn't do anything beyond that. I promise.

I hear there is a Japanese festival called the Tori no Ichi, where people wish for good fortune and prosperity.
My only experience with it is from the library, but it sounded like something perfect for Jaguar Warrior.
It looks so fun and lively.

Senpai. Da Vinci gave me this strange candy. It looks like red and white glow sticks... Eh? They're Japanese sugar sticks called "chitose-ame"?
I see. That is very interesting!

So much happened this year, and now the year is drawing to an end...
Do you have any unfinished business, Master?
December may be the busiest month of the year, but there's still time to catch up!

Despite our situation, we shouldn't forget to prepare for the new year.
We are going to get very busy, Senpai!

They say an outstanding Master always has outstanding luck.
...Well actually, that's just something I thought of...
Anyway, it's all about collecting resources, Master! Let's save them wisely!

It seems like we now have a good number of Santas now...
Is it normal for there to be more Santas every year?

Happy New Year, Senpai!
Teehee...I really like saying that, even though you can only do it once a year.
Um...I would very much like to do it again...next year.

A very happy New Year!
I wonder what's in store for us this year?
But no matter what it may be, I will only give my best.
I look forward to working with you again this year, Master!

I hear people in Japan exchange New Years postcards called nengajou. I would like to send some out one day.
Eh? I can send them right now? And give them by hand? P-please wait a moment! I'm just going to grab some postcards right now!
It seems our situation has slowly been changing. We'll need to be careful not to fall ill due to the change in environment.

As it's a new year, it may be a good idea to start something new.
Is there anything that might interest you, Senpai?

Ah...ah...ah-choo!
S-Senpai...you didn't happen to hear that, did you!?
The season to exchange chocolates is here once again. It seems livelier this year than in the past. If I had to guess why...I'd say it's all the voices...

Eating udon at the cafeteria versus eating nabeyaki udon in my own room...
I didn't think there would be any difference until I tried it...but what a surprise.
I feel like I could write an entire thesis on this subject, Senpai.

I looked up a plant called "horsetail" in the library. The way it looks like it's trying really hard to stretch up to the skies is so cute. And the name horsetail is appropriate because of how it looks!
I wonder if it's delicious to eat...

Senpai, did the Rayshift make you sick?
How many resources do you see?
...No, actually there's fewer than that.
Shall I fetch the Doctor?

Feeling the nice warm spring breeze is uplifting.
Come on, Master. Let's complete the mission quickly!
Girls' Day is one of my favorite celebrations. You line up all those miniature dolls and display them. The pink-themed color scheme and the male and female dolls all look very cute!

Plum blossoms, peach blossoms, and cherry blossoms.
Hmmm...distinguishing them is quite difficult, but they are all beautiful.

The spring sunlight is getting more intense.
At this rate, summer's just around the corner. We should enjoy going on spring excursions while we have the chance!

Senpai, do you know the difference between hiking and picnicking? Supposedly it's a difference between whether your focus is on walking or eating your lunch.
I think both are wonderful. After all, both activities involve an outing with you!

Viewing flowers is fun, but I hear that it's more fun if you are able to drink.
How much happier do you think these people who can drink and view flowers are, compared to us?
I'd sure like to be an adult soon...

Spring is winding down. Is there anything you wanted to do, Senpai?
And don't forget to do this mission, of course!

Master. Da Vinci said she hung some flags shaped like carp outside the Border! She says she made them inconspicuous using some sort of active camouflage effect or something!
It's great that we won't be detected by enemies, but I can't see them that well either...

How curious. It's been said in the past by many others, but I also feel that the combination of rain and hydrangeas are wonderful.
Is this what you call aesthetics?

Today's weather tells us that it's the start of summer.
Let's get our bodies ready in anticipation of the season to come!

The situation has been resolved.
What had happened in the Singularity will never be recorded in history, but it will remain within our memories.
I just hope I can accompany Senpai in the battles to come.

We should enjoy the time spent indoors in a meaningful way, especially when we can't go outdoors. Whether that's helping clean up your room, or playing board games with you, Mash Kyrielight will be ready at a moments notice!

Celebrating our four year anniversary...
I'm not entirely sure why, but saying that is exciting. I have a feeling we will meet a lot of new people!
I hear Caesar is working out in preparation for summer. He is a Servant though, so I don't think there will be much change...
We're at the halfway point of the year. Let's plan ahead for the rest of the year!

Summer is here!
I'm even excited about the Master Missions.
Let's not succumb to the heat and make sure we keep our health and safety in mind!

The Holy Grails that we've been collecting are genuine, potent sources of magical energy.
The Holy Grail that is said to be an omnipotent wish granting device, while its structure is similar to ours, is different in scale and lifespan. Please don't forget that.
We now have more Servants wearing swimsuits, but I'm starting to hope that Senpai starts wearing one as well.

It looks like the summer festivities have ended without incident.
It doesn't seem like we have another big event for a while, so let's just take it easy.

Are you leveling up everyone's Skills?
Some Servants can fight well even with low level Skills, while some Skills change in functionality entirely when they reach maximum level. Think carefully when enhancing them, and your tactical options will expand.

While you have only a limited number of Holy Grails, hoarding them would also be a waste.
Please use them on Servants who you feel you should.

We managed to return safely once more.
Our battles will get tougher, so please command me with all your resolve.
...Anyway, here are the resources we collected this time!
What's this? Well, I asked Ms. Murasaki to recommend some books. They say that autumn is the best season for reading, you know!

Even if it's just in the simulator, maybe we should go see the autumn foliage.
I'll be more than happy to apprentice under Cat to learn the art of bento-making!

Hm!? A blackout.
Don't worry. I'm an expert at this now.
I can give you your Saint Quartz Fragments with my eyes closed. Here you go!

The base's population is booming, but it's just you and me here as usual.
I kind of like that this place stays constant and unchanging.

The distinctive scent that fills the air when I pull our winter clothes out of storage conjures so many memories...
I like that it reminds me of the seasons changing.

Now that I think about it, do you suppose it snows in the Wandering Sea?
And if it does, I wonder what that looks like. I'm very curious about this...
I'll ask Sion next time!

The Santa Servants are starting to get restless.
I guess it's that time of the year already!

In preparation for the big end of the year cleaning, I've stocked up on new cleaning supplies!!
Now I'll be ready anytime!

Senpai! I hear Beni-Enma is going to prepare us all special New Year's soba!
Oh my...
I'm getting so excited, I'm feeling dizzy!

Happy New Year, Master!
I love how this year is just full of twos!
And on that note, let's begin this year with a fresh mindset...too!

I hear people usually either spend the New Year by taking it easy or going out and painting the town red...
How do you spend your time, Senpai?

It's a new year.
This might be an opportune time to try something new!

What is your favorite way to eat mochi, Senpai?
My favorite way is...
Hmmm...I really can't decide, to be honest...

I just had an epiphany about a new food to eat at the kotatsu that beats mandarin oranges or nabeyaki udon!
Ice cream!
It's a true guilty pleasure only advanced kotatsu experts will appreciate!

The season of sweets is upon us once again.
Just don't forget to brush your teeth to prevent cavities, Master.

The days are still chilly.
When I wake up in the morning and find Fou sleeping next to me in bed, I feel very lucky.

Did you know that the next leap year is going to be in two years?
Just the thought of having an extra day in a year makes me feel like I gained something special, Senpai!

It's March.
Did you know that the month is named after Mars, the god of war?
...I wonder how Altera would react if she heard.

So this dish is called chirashizushi!?
It's so colorful and it's definitely fit for auspicious events!
I'm sure it's also delicious...!
Gulp!
It's hard to notice the changing of the seasons here...but it's probably best to continue to bear that in mind.

This is... a very valuable resource! 
You always work so hard, and now I've finally seen your destiny realized!

Happy New Year. 
I look forward to working with you again this year!

Have you been to the temple yet? 
If not, then let's go together...!

Happy New Year, Senpai.
I'm glad to have a chance to tell you that this year.

Have you had your first dream of the new year, Senpai?
I have yet to have my own, so I'm going to try my best tonight!

Have you had your first dream of the new year, Senpai?
I have yet to have my own, so I'm going to try my best tonight!

Have you had your first dream of the new year, Senpai?
I have yet to have my own, so I'm going to try my best tonight!

Early sunrises, late sunsets...
When the days get long, it's nice to feel how long the days are, Senpai.

Surprisingly, this year is more than half over. 
Let's make a plan in advance and calmly carry it out, Master!
I heard people go to the beach in the summer. A bathing suit... I don't think I'm ready for that, but I'd like to ray shift at the beach and go swimming.
...So this is Earth's summer... Do your best, Senpai. Don't let the heat get you down.
Well done, Master. You should go ask the doctor for some shaved ice when you get a chance.

Here you are, have some nice, cool barley tea. 
Stay hydrated so the heat doesn't wear you out, Senpai.
This heat isn't going to let up any time soon, but I hear the dog days of summer are the best. Keep fighting, Master!

It's easy to get sick when the seasons change. 
Take care of yourself, Master.
By the way... Does Fou have a hair loss season?
It's gotten much cooler. It's much easier to be active now. Will you come train with me, Master?
Autumn food is delicious. I love freshly baked bread!
Fall foliage... In Japan, the mountains are so red, they look like they're on fire... I'd love to go and see the leaves with you, Senpai.

Do you have your coat ready? 
It's finally getting cold out, Master.

Please inform me if you catch a cold. 
I'll do my best to nurse you back to health!

Next month is packed with events. 
Are you ready, Senpai?

This year is nearly over. 
Keep working hard until the end, Master!
The deciding battle is near, but please try to relax here. Let's do this the way we always do.
It's cold outside, but I feel warm when you're near, Senpai. Is this an example of the heat island phenomenon...?

It seems there are many benefits of eating rice cakes, such as longevity. 
Master, what do you think about having rice cakes at every meal?

So this is Ozoni soup... 
It's very tasty. It feels like it's warming me up from inside.
It's been very cold... I'm just a little jealous of Fou.

There's a warm spring waiting for us if we can just get through this cold. 
Let's be sure to keep warm until then, Master!

There's a sweet smell coming from somewhere...
Senpai, do you like sweets?

If we added wheels to a kotatsu, that would be an amazing machine...
I'm sure it'd be more useful than Da Vinci's gauntlets...

It's eased up a bit, but it's still chilly. 
Make sure to wrap up warmly when you sleep, Senpai.

I hear that in Japan, spring is known as the season of meeting and parting. 
Both of them are important.

I heard that everything is dyed pink when the cherry blossoms are in full bloom... 
If such a dreamy landscape exists I'd like to go see it with you, Senpai.

It's a lot warmer now, but spring is also cold season. 
Senpai, please take care of yourself even more than usual, okay?

Hay fever... yes, I hear that the symptoms are terrible. 
Are you all right Senpai?

I get sleepy when it gets warmer. Shall we rest a bit?
Leave the schedule to me. If you let me know when you want to be woken up, I'll wake you up on the dot!

It's much easier to carry out daily activities now that it's warmer.
But I kind of miss the cool of winter a little.

Here, have a warm cup of tea.
It's not the best grade of tea... but I hope you like it.

When I'm with you my heart rate changes.
...Is this a symptom of the so-called "Senioritis," Senpai?

It's a very rainy season, isn't it?
Let's check the weather for our destination so we don't get wet, or just carry an umbrella everywhere!

It's time for short sleeves, but do you have UV protection, Master?
Careful attention is effective in the long run.

S-so this is a teruteru bozu, the Japanese talisman said to bring good weather!
I see...
It does look like it's smiling at me.
How cute!

It feels like it really is summer, especially during the day.
But then again, it can get surprisingly chilly at night.
Let's make sure we regulate our body temperatures.

Um, Senpai, have you seen Fou around?
I haven't seen him anywhere...

A festival?
I hear that in Japan one wears a summer kimono to enjoy watching fireworks while eating things called "cotton candy" and "chocolate-covered bananas."
If I have the chance, I would like to watch fireworks with Senpai.

Leave it to Mash Kyrielight, Master.
I shall obtain two servings of frozen treats, right away!

Let's be mindful of our health if we want to enjoy our summer.
Don't forget to stay hydrated, Senpai.

It may be hard to sleep when it's so hot, but make sure you don't overuse the AC.
I hear that getting too cold is bad for even the sturdiest of psyches!

It's still very hot, but summer will be over soon.
I suggest we prepare for fall!

There's only a little over three months left in the year.
If there's anything you haven't finished yet, you should get to work soon!

I hear that in Japan there is a time of the year where the deceased are remembered.
To know that such a thing has taken root warms my heart.

Senpai, I have freshly-baked bread, so I would like to share―
Calories...?
...No, I've never heard that word before.
...This is the first I've ever heard of it.

The temperature difference between night and day is getting more extreme.
Do not forget to bring a jacket when you go out.

I hear that sunsets during this season are particularly beautiful. A heartwarming, nostalgic kind of thing...
Chaldea is my home, so it's disappointing that I do not get to see many sunsets.

There are still warm days, but the nights are truly chilly...
Shall I prepare something warm to drink, Senpai?

How are you keeping yourself from getting sick, Senpai?
Don't forget to always wash your hands and stay warm! You should be diligent!

I hear that when it gets cold, people yearn for the touch of another.
Senpai... Is...is that true?

The battle for the warmth of the kotatsu―The First Kotatsu War―has broken out, and casualties are mounting...
Master, let's go.
We need to put an end to this.

...The investigators from the Mage's Association are coming soon...
I'm sure big changes are coming, but I hope that my memories of these past two years will remain the same...and Doctor's room, too.

Herring roe, rolled kelp, kurikinton...
What is your favorite osechi dish, Senpai?

Da Vinci has prepared a game of hanetsuki and bamboo stilts in the Recreation Room, for a limited time.
Would you like to go, Senpai?
A new year may have come, but it's still the dead of winter. Please take good care of yourself, Senpai.

February...
It's the season of sweet smells floating through the air. We need to be careful about eating too many sweets, Master.

It's so cold, I won't be surprised if it starts snowing.
If it does snow, I would like to make an igloo.

Tangerines, tea, and a dotera robe...
Tee hee, what do you think, Senpai? I am a proper kotatsu Master now, right?

Winter or spring... I'm not sure which seasonal equipment to chose right now.
I suppose it's a nice problem to have, though.
It seems the men are working hard on something...

Grass and trees waiting to sprout through a covering of snow...
With that image in mind, let's store up our power, too!

Oh, Senpai...I'm sorry, I didn't notice you.
It's so warm, and holding onto Fou...so fluffy... It's so nice... Just sitting here...
Zzzzz... Zzzz...

...Wow, that thunder was loud.
So this is the iconic spring thunder...
Though it's hard not to wonder if someone just fired off their Noble Phantasm, too.

A new battlefield... New equipment...
Our situation seems dire, but let's take a deep breath and move forward!

The days are no longer just nice and warm, but truly hot.
Summer is getting close, Senpai.

...?
What is that smell coming from you, Senpai...?
I see, sweet flag water...
What an interesting custom.

Have you gotten used to riding the Shadow Border?
I hope we have some medicine for car sickness...

Happy New Year, Master!
I love how this year is just full of twos!
And on that note, let's begin this year with a fresh mindset...too!

I hear people usually either spend the New Year by taking it easy or going out and painting the town red...
How do you spend your time, Senpai?

It's a new year.
This might be an opportune time to try something new!

What is your favorite way to eat mochi, Senpai?
My favorite way is...
Hmmm...I really can't decide, to be honest...

I just had an epiphany about a new food to eat at the kotatsu that beats mandarin oranges or nabeyaki udon!
Ice cream!
It's a true guilty pleasure only advanced kotatsu experts will appreciate!

The season of sweets is upon us once again.
Just don't forget to brush your teeth to prevent cavities, Master.

The days are still chilly.
When I wake up in the morning and find Fou sleeping next to me in bed, I feel very lucky.

Did you know that the next leap year is going to be in two years?
Just the thought of having an extra day in a year makes me feel like I gained something special, Senpai!

It's March.
Did you know that the month is named after Mars, the god of war?
...I wonder how Altera would react if she heard.

So this dish is called chirashizushi!?
It's so colorful and it's definitely fit for auspicious events!
I'm sure it's also delicious...!
Gulp!
It's hard to notice the changing of the seasons here...but it's probably best to continue to bear that in mind.

Have you ever been to a school orientation before, Senpai?
I hear it makes you quite nervous...
Please tell me about it one of these days!

Flower-viewing season is upon us once again, and the simulator is very popular right now.
Shall we also check it out, Senpai?
I'll prepare a picnic, blanket and all!

All resources are valuable.
Remember that dazzling sparkle, and be thrilled by that spiky shape...
Come on, Master! Let's get to work on our missions!

Old Japanese calendars used to call the month of May "Satsuki," which is associated with the rice planting season.
If we have the chance, I would very much like to try my hand at planting rice!
...If there is ever such a mission, that is...

Whoa! Senpai and Fou just yawned at the same time!
I wish I'd taken a picture of such perfect synchronization!
Hehe...feeling drowsy all the time is a sure sign that it's spring!

I've gotten the hang of polishing Saint Quartz Fragments!
They're shiny enough that you can see yourself in them, Senpai!
...Do you think if we ask Da Vinci, she could make this a part of some sort of interior design?

Senpai, here are your new workout outfits and indoor shoes. Please wear them during your workout routine.
I also received a similar set with the same design!
Maybe you and I should go on a jog together?

It's starting to feel like summer.
I have a strange sense that this summer will be our scariest ever...
No, I shouldn't say such crazy things... Please ignore what I said!

It's the most humid part of the year, so make sure to get a lot of circulation in your room!
You wouldn't want to be scolded by bread makers for accidently letting their bread get moldy, Senpai!

It's almost summer.
You may want to just settle for eating something simple, but try to eat a well-balanced meal to build up your strength.

Missions may change on a weekly basis, but you have plenty of time to complete them.
Work on the missions at your own pace.

"Playing board games is fine, but it's also good to have an outdoor hobby, like fishing."
...At least that's what Emiya said.
Fishing in Chaldea...may be a bit challenging.

The hot summer has come once again!
I hear that people get extended days-off during this time.
Prepare yourself well against the heat and enjoy your vacation!

Use the Holy Grails you obtained to further strengthen your Servants' Spirit Origins.
You may feel compelled to hold on to them, but sometimes it's best to take the plunge and use them!

Summer excursions aren't just limited to the beach.
You can enjoy camping up in the mountains...
It appears you can even play in and learn from nature.
That does seem fun.

We're about halfway through the year already.
The days may still be hot, but let's keep a positive mindset and live the time we have to the fullest!

I hear that Ascension and strengthening a Servant's Spirit Origin using a Holy Grail are different things.
A Heroic Spirit's Spirit Origin is set based on a Servant's information from their past life, no matter how far you Ascend them. But you can use a Holy Grail to foster a special kind of growth.

Is your party fully strengthened and at the ready?
Instead of focusing only on Servants specializing in offense, try training Servants who specialize in defense and support too.

The records of those who left their mark on human history, whether good or bad, which are known as Heroic Spirits in Chaldea, are collected and stored in a higher realm called the Throne.
...And that's why anybody who has not achieved anything truly great never becomes a Servant candidate.
Though it seems that occasionally, a string of coincidences and a touch of fate can lead to a miracle.

Summer is over, and we're heading into the next season.
Is your wardrobe ready for the changing season?
Please take every precaution to ensure you stay healthy!

Try raising various Servants in anticipation of the many battles ahead.
Servants are all unique in their own way, and they are all reliable when the time comes!

A war between Masters over the Holy Grail...
I read about it in our archives, but I never thought something like that would happen in Chaldea too. I am...I am...quite moved!

You're wondering if I'm a good dancer?
Not really. It was an elective in my training curriculum, but I did not take it...
Pepe and Kirschtaria did take the course, so I just watched and copied what they did...

Changing into different Mystic Codes depending on the situation is what makes a veteran Master. There are many skills associated with the different Mystic Codes, so please try changing to suit your party.

Christmas is here!
I wonder what sort of Santa we'll have this year? I'm so excited!
Dairi, the inner palace of the Heian period, and the Kyoto Imperial Palace in modern-day Kyoto City are not located in the same place. Dairi was supposedly west of the Kyoto Imperial Palace.

Servants are divided into attack and support types. A majority of the Caster-class Servants are support types, so try not to form your party with just Sabers or Lancers; try using Casters to help you out.

It's now 2023. Happy New Year!
I hope we have yet another wonderful year, Senpai!

This year is the Year of the Ox. It’s Raikou’s year!
Oh. I wasn't thinking about her physique, but rather about when she got really serious at Onigashima...
It's getting really cold now. Don't forget to wear gloves and a mask when you head out. Your neck is the most vulnerable to cold, so wearing a scarf would also be helpful.

Osechi, the traditional Japanese New Years meal set, is a nice culinary tradition.
It's aesthetically pleasing, each dish goes down easy, and they're all so delicious...
The fact that most of the dishes are sweet is wonderful too!
I hear that you can eat the same amount of black soybeans as your age! Yay!
There are more Daily and Weekly mission types now. But don't worry if you're busy. You just need to do the quests at your own pace.
The season for chocolates is upon us once again. Please be careful not to get any cavities, Senpai.
Have you been using Holy Grails, Master? You can spread them among numerous Servants or focus on one Servant. There's nothing for you to lose, so have at it.

By the way, I picked this up earlier. It seems like some sort of...calling card.
I thought it was Carmilla's, but it's not. The plot thickens, Senpai.

March... It's graduation season in Japan.
I hear there's a Japanese custom to ask for a button from someone's uniform. Specifically, the second button from the top.
What about you, Senpai...no, wait! Never mind!

Orion was agonizing over what to give Artemis as a return gift. He was claiming that it would also  be terrible if he put TOO much sentiment into his return gift too. That is definitely a concern you'd only have with Artemis.
QP, short for Quantum Pieces, should be diligently collected and saved. You may not use much at first, but you will gradually have more and more use for them.

One, two, three...
Oh, Senpai! N-nothing. I was just practicing my dancing, since it's spring and all.
Would you like to join me, Senpai?
Edison is currently researching whether we can increase the amount of Saint Quartz Fragments. I  honestly think that's a tall order, even for the king of inventions...

If you use just one Servant as an attacker during a turn, you will only be able to attack one enemy. But if you put a Noble Phantasm between attacks, you can potentially attack two or even three enemies. Think about the enemy's HP gauge and build strategies.
You'll wind up out of shape if you stay cooped up in Chaldea. Would you like to try some training exercises you could do indoors?
According to Da Vinci's analysis, we're bound to see a lot of minute Singularities again this year. Let's try our best to tackle them, Senpai!
Firing Noble Phantasms in one turn feels really good...but certain enemies have Break Bars, so it's meaningless to inflict damage with your Noble Phantasm on those enemies. Please be careful.

June... It's the rainy season in Japan.
Senpai, when you told me the Japanese term uses the kanji "plum" and "rain," I thought it meant the rain was sour like plums. Teehee.

Holmes is the world's most famous detective, and he has been the subject of many paintings and sculptures. However, the inverness coat and deerstalker hat he's famously depicted with were never described in the original stories. That was apparently created by the person who was in charge of the book's illustrations.
Evade and Invincibility have two different durations: times and turns. The times effect is quickly used up if you're up against large enemies who have AOE attacks, so please be careful.
Summer's about to start again. I have a feeling a thrilling adventure awaits us! Let's prepare while we have the chance!

Have you been practicing proper precautions against the heat? Please be careful not to get afflicted with heat stress, Senpai.
Then again, it's not good to cool yourself too much too. Balancing both is quite challenging...

The C. Stars dropped from attacking enemies or from skills increase the chance to inflict a Critical Hit by 10% each.
Please also keep in mind that certain classes have easier or harder times gathering C. Stars.
It's getting even hotter these days. Please do take care of yourself, Senpai. I hear Emiya is thinking up dishes that are good for fighting the heat.
I know the days have been hot, but it'll be autumn soon, and that's more comfortable. Until then, let's enjoy the summer, Senpai.
It's September already. Time sure does fly. I hear in Japan many fruits are in season. What kind of fruits were available and loved in your hometown, Master?
The seasons in the northern and southern hemispheres are flipped. For example, in Australia, it's a pleasantly warm spring right now and it's supposed to get hotter and hotter.
Edison and Tesla claim to have invented a "revolutionary weather forecast machine." But honestly, where in Chaldea are they going to use this device?

It's autumn! Master, I hope you're prepared.
Come on, let's prepare pumpkins!

Master, Master!
Elisabeth is in such a good mood, she started singing in the cafeteria! Everyone's begging you to go to the cafeteria immediately!

It's starting to get chilly.
Try not to catch a cold due to the changing seasons. Make sure you're well-protected from the cold before you Rayshift! Though the season wherever you Rayshift may not necessarily be the same...

It's winter now. Prepare all the necessary equipment so you aren't harmed by the harsh weather.
Just like combat, it's important to be on your guard and defend yourself!

(Huff, huff...)
!
I can't believe the sweet potato we roasted using just the leaves we collected turned out so delicious... What kind of skill did you use, Senpai!?
Scheherazade is going to hold a reading tonight. I'm excited to see what kind of story she'll read. But I need to be careful not to stay up too late because I get too engrossed in it.
